NAEB PLACEMENT SERVICE
Anyone wishing to register with the NAEB Placement Service should write to Mr,
Robert E. Underwood, Jr,, 14 Gregory Hall, Urbana, Illinois, and the proper
forms ^ill be forwarded to you by return mail. Also, any inquiries concerning
applicants should be addressed to Mr. Underwood.
The following descriptions of personnel registered with us are taken directly
from the Placement Service Forms.
August 1, AMBITIOUS, RESOURCEFUL, RELIABLE young woman wishes a position which
will provide an opportunity for work, study, and promotion. Qualifications:
active participation in numerous phases and activities of society, school, and
church since childhood; five years of college work in the field of music educa¬
tion which includes a bachelor’s degree and ten graduate hours; a desire to be
of creative service to society.
August 2. Young man, 25, College graduate, married veteran. One year exper¬
ience in commercial television, three years Workshop experience. Desires a
position teaching or a combination of teaching and directing. Excellent refer¬
ences and good potential. Some teaching experience and proven leadership ability.
No locational preferences, but desire work-inspiring conditions. Ready to settle
down and start family.
August 3. Wanted: Job in a television station. Prefer work in the educational
field of TV. Have had radio and teaching experience.
August 4« JACK-OF-ALL-TRADES seeks interesting, challenging position. Now
employed Director Radio-TV, major university. Thoroughly experienced in edu¬
cational as well as commercial mass media including radio, tv, motion pictures
and theatre. Eight years teaching experience. Administrator, producer, director,
writer, promotion, talent or what have you. Award-winning specialist in low
budget production. If you need an idea man who can follow through capably, thoro¬
ughly and efficiently, I’d like to try to fill the bill.
August 5. Need someone with these qualifications? BA degree, production exper¬
ience, Special Services Officer, presently directing. Available immediately.
August 6. EIGHT YEARS EXPERIENCE IN RADIO including jobs as Music Director,
Ass’t Program Director, Station Manager, planner of live and recorded programs
of fine music, continuity writer, and announcer (esp0 good at ad-lib interviews).
Presently, Music Director, Station KEAR, San Francisco. Had own program on WQXR,
New York City and for two years on WILL, Urbana, Illinois, Has also taught
courses in music literature and music history at University of Illinois, at M. I.T.,
Univ. of Connecticut, Hunter College. Has also lectured extensively before adult
audiences. Can furnish finest references. Has splendid background in music
study, radio experience and college teaching. Wishes to locate job with education¬
al radio and/or TV station (preferably as Program or Music Director) combined,
if possible, with teaching duties in college music or radio department. Graduate
of Amherst College. 4 years of graduate study at Harvard. Available immediately,
August 7. Desire TV job as Producer-Director. MS, Radio-TV, University of Illi¬
nois. 2-g- years commercial radio experience (announcer, copy writer, and newsman)
plus teaching experience. Will teach broadcast courses; might consider other
production jobs.
